1313.name: ErrCreatingKubernetesComponentsCode
1313.probable_cause:
component generation was canceled due to deletion or reload of K8s context
Invalid kubeconfig
Filters passed incorrectly in config
Could not fetch API resources from Kubernetes server
1313.suggested_remediation:
If there is the log \"Starting to register ...\" for the same contextID after this error means that for some reason the context was reloaded which caused this run to abort. In that case, this error can be ignored.
Make sure that the configuration filters passed are in accordance with output from /openapi/v2

1314.name: ErrGetK8sComponentsCode
1314.short_description: Could not get K8s components for registration
1314.probable_cause:
Invalid kubeconfig
Filters passed incorrectly in config
Could not fetch API resources from Kubernetes server
1314.suggested_remediation: Make sure that the configuration filters passed are in accordance with output from /openapi/v2

1315.suggested_remediation: Ensure YAML is a valid Kubernetes Manifest

1335.suggested_remediation: Make sure the URL is correct

1336.name: ErrCloseIoReaderCode
1336.probable_cause: An error occurred while attempting to close response body reader.
1336.suggested_remediation: Ensure the response body reader is in a state that allows it to be closed.

1340.name: ErrLogoutCode
1340.probable_cause:
Session might already been revoked
Remote provider is not able to complete the request
1340.suggested_remediation: Close the tabs and open Meshery UI again. Optionally, try using a private/incognito browser window.

1341.name: ErrGetSessionCookieCode
1341.short_description: Error occurred while getting session cookie

1346.name: ErrGenerateK8sHandlerCode
1346.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid Kubernetes context, missing configuration, or network issues.
1346.suggested_remediation: Verify the Kubernetes context configuration. Ensure the Kubernetes cluster is reachable and the configuration is correct.

1347.name: ErrRetrieveK8sClusterIDCode
1347.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid Kubernetes context, missing or incorrect configuration, or network issues.
1347.suggested_remediation: Verify the Kubernetes context configuration. Ensure the Kubernetes cluster is reachable and the configuration is correct.

1348.name: ErrCreateResourceEntryCode
1348.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid input data, database issues, or network problems.
1348.suggested_remediation: Verify the input data is correct. Ensure the database is reachable and properly configured.

1349.name: ErrInitializeDBHandlerCode
1349.probable_cause: Possible causes include incorrect database file path, invalid database engine configuration, or insufficient permissions.
1349.suggested_remediation: Verify the database file path and ensure it is correct. Check the database engine configuration and ensure the application has the necessary permissions to access the database file.

1350.name: ErrDeleteK8sResourceCode
1350.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid resource name or namespace, insufficient permissions, or network issues.
1350.suggested_remediation: Verify the resource name and namespace are correct. Ensure you have the necessary permissions to delete the resource. Check network connectivity to the Kubernetes cluster.

1351.name: ErrCreateK8sResourceCode
1351.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid resource name or namespace, insufficient permissions, or network issues.
1351.suggested_remediation: Verify the resource name and namespace are correct. Ensure you have the necessary permissions to create the resource. Check network connectivity to the Kubernetes cluster.

1352.name: ErrGetResourceCode
1352.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid resource name or namespace, insufficient permissions, or resource not found.
1352.suggested_remediation: Verify the resource name and namespace are correct. Ensure you have the necessary permissions to access the resource.

1353.name: ErrDeleteResourceCode
1353.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid resource name or namespace, insufficient permissions, or network issues.
1353.suggested_remediation: Verify the resource name and namespace are correct. Ensure you have the necessary permissions to delete the resource. Check network connectivity to the Kubernetes cluster.

1354.name: ErrRecreateResourceCode
1354.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid resource configuration, insufficient permissions, or network issues.
1354.suggested_remediation: Verify the resource configuration and ensure it is correct. Ensure you have the necessary permissions to recreate the resource. Check network connectivity to the Kubernetes cluster.

1355.name: ErrUpdateResourceCode
1355.probable_cause: Possible causes include invalid resource configuration, insufficient permissions, or network issues.
1355.suggested_remediation: Verify the resource configuration and ensure it is correct. Ensure you have the necessary permissions to update the resource. Check network connectivity to the Kubernetes cluster.

1356.name: ErrEmptySessionCode
1356.long_description: Unable to find \"token\" cookie in the request.
1356.short_description: No session found in the request
1356.probable_cause:
User is not authenticated with the selected Provider.
Browser might be restricting use of cookies.
1356.suggested_remediation:
Choose a Provider and login to establish an active session (receive a new token and cookie). Optionally, try using a private/incognito browser window.
Verify that your browser settings allow cookies.

1357.name: ErrInvalidEventDataCode
1357.long_description: ActedUpon, Action, Category and Severity are required fields of an event
1357.short_description: The event provided is not valid
1357.suggested_remediation: Ensure that ActedUpon, Action, Category and Severity are present in the event

1358.name: ErrSeedingComponentsCode
1358.short_description: Failed to register the given models into meshery's registry
1358.probable_cause:
Given models may not be in accordance with Meshery's schema
Internal(OS level) error while reading files
1358.suggested_remediation:
Make sure the models being seeded are valid in accordance with Meshery's schema
If it is an internal error, please try again after some time

1359.name: ErrImportFailureCode
1359.probable_cause:
Entity definition might not be in accordance with schema
Entity version might not be supported by Meshery
1359.suggested_remediation: See the registration logs (found at $HOME/.meshery/logs/registry/registry-logs.log) to find out which Entity failed to be imported with more specific error information.

1362.name: ErrGetComponentDefinitionCode
1362.probable_cause:
Component might not have been registered
The component might not be supported by default, in the version of Meshery you are currently using.
1362.suggested_remediation:
Ensure component definition is valid JSON/YAML.
Import the model and try again.

1363.name: ErrGetCapabilitiesCode
1363.probable_cause: Remote provider server may be down or not accepting requests.
1363.suggested_remediation: Make sure remote provider server is healthy and accepting requests.

1364.name: ErrExportPatternInFormatCode
1364.suggested_remediation: Export design in one of the supported format.

1365.name: ErrNoTarInsideOCiCode
1365.long_description: Unable to locate the compressed file(.tar.gz) inside the OCI image.
1365.short_description: No tar file found inside OCI image
1365.probable_cause: The OCI image does not contain a ziped file.
1365.suggested_remediation: Verify that the OCI image contains a ziped file.
